action.action-desc: Mr. Brooks (for himself, Mr. Gosar, Mr. Duncan, Mr. Gibbs, Mr. Perry, Mr. Mast, Mr. Babin, Mr. Tiffany, Mrs. Miller of Illinois, and Mr. Donalds) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Energy and Commerce, and in addition to the Committee on Transportation and Infrastructure, for a period to be subsequently determined by the Speaker, in each case for consideration of such provisions as fall within the jurisdiction of the committee concerned

form.official-title: To amend the Public Health Service Act to limit the authority of the Department of Health and Human Services to regulate interstate commerce relating to communicable diseases, to amend title 49, United States Code, to limit the authority of the Federal Aviation Administration to regulate air commerce relating to communicable diseases, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Freedom to Fly Maskless Act of 2022.
Section 361 of the Public Health Service Act (42 U.S.C. 264) is amended—

paragraph.text: in subsection (c), by striking Except as provided in subsection (d), regulations prescribed and inserting Regulations prescribed;
by redesignating subsection (e) as subsection (d); and
after making such redesignation, by adding at the end the following:

subsection.text: Notwithstanding subsection (a), and subject to subsection (c), nothing in this section authorizes requiring individuals—

paragraph.text: to undergo screening, testing, or treatment, including vaccination;

section.header: Limitation on air commerce safety regulations
section.text: Section 44701 of title 49, United States Code, is amended by adding at the end the following:

subsection.header: Prohibition on regulations relating to certain health requirements

paragraph.text: Notwithstanding subsection (a)(5), the Administrator may not prescribe any regulations or minimum standards for safety in air commerce that require an individual to—

subparagraph.text: undergo screening, testing, or treatment, including vaccination, for any communicable disease;
quarantine or isolate as a result of exposure, or potential exposure, to a communicable disease; or

paragraph.text: In this subsection, the term air commerce has the meaning given such term in section 40102 but does not include foreign air commerce.
